entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 160 to 240 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h, and thunderstorms possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been decreased to Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 220 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, especially about the ranges. Thunderstorms possible. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected Saturday and Sunday mornings. Note, rain is forecast to ease for a time during Saturday afternoon and evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Warning period extended.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Thunderstorms possible. Note, rain is forecast to ease for a time during Saturday afternoon and evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: High.
